availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob Schmitt (Louisville, KY, blacksmith and hardware merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, blacksmith and hardware merchant. Native of Germany. Son of Christian Schmitt and Phillippina Schmitt. Married to Louisa Fildhardt Schmitt in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on May 31, 1847. Father of Jacob Scmitt, Jr., Charles G. Schmitt, Louisa Schmitt, and Matilda Schmitt. Married to Mary Elizabeth Eberbeck Schmitt in Louisville, Kentucky, on October 31, 1861. Father of George A. Schmitt and Ernest T. Schmitt. Immigrated to the United States in 1842. Blacksmith in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1848. Blacksmith in Louisville in 1850. Hardware merchant in partnership with George Barthel in Louisville from 1854 to 1856. Hardware merchant in Louisville from 1856 through 1865.
